detaileddescription.para:
This helps to declare and identify inline static functions for the LIN Integration component
Value: static inline

This helps to declare and identify static functions for the LIN Integration component
Value: static
This variable will store the requests for switching the state of LIN channels.
This array will store the hardware status for the LIN channels

briefdescription.para: This function will initialize the specified LIN interface.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: LinTsk thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

simplesect.para: The LIN interface corresponding to the provided LIN index will be initialized using the standard API.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_InitializeInterface

simplesect.title: Traceability

briefdescription.para: This function will cyclically handle the mode changes for all the LINs.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a local function in the scope of the existing file.
reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
No precondition
No postcondition
void
void Globals
LinChannelModeRequests[] Input->Output-Correlation
For each LIN index the status of the flag for online/offline/normal/sleep mode request will be checked using the global LinChannelModeRequests[]. If the flag is set will call the corresponding interface to activate the mode and reset the flag. Call Sequence
Test Method
The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_HandleModeChanges_Cyclic
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to handle the mode changes for all the LINs cyclically.

briefdescription.para: Inline static function to return the LIN interface to handle based on the provided LIN index.

parameterdescription.para: - LIN index for which the interface is requested

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - output based on parameter multicore safe: Yes - output based on parameter synchronous

simplesect.title: Call Sequence
simplesect.para: This helper function assumes that LIN_IFC_NR_MAX == LIN_CHANNELS_COUNT For this reason the function will return the provided parameter linIndex

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinIndexToHandle

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to return the corresponding LIN interface for the provided LIN index.

briefdescription.para: Inline static function to return the LIN communication channel based on the provided LIN index.

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - output based on parameter multicore safe: Yes - output based on parameter synchronous
TComChannel - LIN channel corresponding to the index

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: Return the Communication channel for the LIN index by adding this index to _ComChannelLinFirst

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinIndexToLinComChannel

briefdescription.para: Inline static function to update the current hardware status for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para:
linIfcHandle
- LIN interface for which the status update is requested
void
reentrant: No context: LinTask thread safe: No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe: No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous Globals
LinChannelHwStatus[] Update the LinChannelHwStatus data for the provided LIN interface with the current hardware status The LIN interface status will be using the l_ifc_read_status interface provided by LIN FlexDriver component Call Sequence
N/A Test Method
The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ReadHwStatus
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to read and update the current hardware status for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: Inline static function to get the current hardware status for a LIN interface.

detaileddescription.para:
The HW status is used by LIN Integration component for error handling. Monitoring the LIN buses will result in detecting errors and providing the status to the ErrHdl component that in turn will set the corresponding DTCs.
reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - only reads memory multicore safe: Yes - only reads memory synchronous
linIfcHandle
- LIN interface for which the status is requested
TLinStatus - updated status for the requested LIN interface Globals
LinChannelHwStatus[] Input->Output-Correlation
Return the LinChannelHwStatus data for the provided LIN interface Call Sequence
N/A Test Method
The testing method is described on The testing method is described on The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_GetHwStatus
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to get the updated current status for a provided LIN interface.

briefdescription.para: This function will check if a specific LIN channel is active.

detaileddescription.para: The function it's used by other SW units of Lin Integration component.

simplesect.para: reentrant: No context: any task thread safe: Yes - only reads memory multicore safe: Yes - only reads memory synchronous

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: Function will return TRUE if given LIN channel is active and FALSE if not.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ComChannel_IsActive

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. Helper function to check if a provided LIN channel is active.

briefdescription.para: This function will request initialization of the LIN channel.

detaileddescription.para: This is an external function to be used by other components.

simplesect.para: reentrant: Yes context: any task thread safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) multicore safe: Yes - atomic memory write (when cache is not enabled) synchronous

simplesect.title: Input->Output-Correlation
simplesect.para: For the provided LIN channel the onlineModeRequested flag in the LinChannelModeRequests[] array will be set to TRUE.

simplesect.title: Test Method
simplesect.para: The testing method is described on TEST_LinInt_ComChannel_RequestOnlineMode

simplesect.title: Traceability
simplesect.para: Design Decision - Justification. This is a helper function to request initialization of the LIN channel.

briefdescription.para: This function allows the application to initialize before the LIN task is started.
